verses.roman:
mat-kṛte pitṛ-putrāṇāṁ
bhrātṛṇāṁ cāpi vigrahaḥ
jāyate hy asatāṁ rājye
mamatā-baddha-cetasām

synonyms: mat-kṛte—for the sake of me; pitṛ-putrāṇām—between fathers and sons; bhrātṛṇām—among brothers; ca—and; api—also; vigrahaḥ—conflict; jāyate—arises; hi—indeed; asatām—among the materialistic; rājye—for political rule; mamatā—by the sense of possession; baddha—bound up; cetasām—whose hearts.
translation: "For the sake of conquering me, materialistic persons fight one another. Fathers oppose their sons, and brothers fight one another, because their hearts are bound to possessing political power.
